snippet: The authorities arrested 15 people in four countries believed to be seeking to overthrow the Kurdish government in northern Iraq and to recruit Islamic State militants.
abstract: Authorities arrest 15 people in four European countries suspected of belonging to terrorism network led by Iraqi Kurdish cleric imprisoned in Norway; investigation focused on Internet, where group's plans to overthrow Kurdish government in Northern Iraq and recruit jihadists for conflicts in Syria and Iraq were primarily developed; suspects are all likely to face charges in Italy of conspiring to commit international terrorism.

byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, and Henrik Pryser Libell from Oslo.

lead_paragraph: The authorities arrested 15 people in four countries believed to be seeking to overthrow the Kurdish government in northern Iraq and to recruit Islamic State militants.

headline.main: Coordinated European Raids Target Ring Supporting Terrorist Groups
headline.print_headline: 15 Are Arrested in Coordinated Antiterrorism Raids Across Europe, Officials Say
